headline: Retail investors are 'optimistic,' but 'realistic' going into 2025
summary: Retail investors are feeling bullish about the market (^DJI, ^IXIC, ^GSPC) in 2025, eToro's fourth quarter Retail Investor Beat shows. eToro investment analyst Bret Kenwell joins Josh Lipton and Seana Smith on Market Domination to discuss how retail investors are thinking about the market headed into the new year. Kenwell says retail investors are "optimistic" but "realistic" for the new year. "They're looking to gain more exposure to crypto in 2025. They're looking to gain more exposure to equities in 2025. But they're also looking to raise some cash here," he says, later adding: "I think they're being prudent, but also, you know, keeping one foot in at least is so they keep getting taking advantage of, you know, more gains to come in 2025 if that is the case." The analyst reports that the survey found retail investors to prefer the financials sector and big-cap tech, including Magnificent Seven names and other artificial intelligence (AI) plays. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Market Domination here. This post was written by Naomi Buchanan.

headline: "Real-world AI" is the next phase of this tech: Portfolio mgr.
summary: Nightview Capital portfolio manager Dan Crowley discusses the transformative potential of artificial intelligence (AI) in 2025 on Market Domination Overtime. "We think we're headed toward a period of rapid technological shifts. Historically, whenever that's happened, significant opportunities have been unlocked," Crowley explains. He believes AI's economic impact could rival that of the internet revolution. Crowley identifies "real-world AI" as the sector's next evolution, highlighting two key investment opportunities. First, he points to "entirely new product-category" companies like Tesla (TSLA), which is advancing autonomous driving technology. Second, he sees potential in established companies with "existing business lines," such as Amazon (AMZN), which can leverage AI to enhance operational efficiency. "We're kind of trying to move into the next phase here of where we see AI playing out," he tells Yahoo Finance. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Market Domination Overtime here. This post was written by Angel Smith

headline: The biggest questions and themes for AI in 2025
summary: The Morning Brief welcomes on New Street Research Technology Infrastructure Analyst Antoine Chkaiban to explore several of the biggest questions surrounding AI capabilities heading into 2025. "We're now about to enter... the third year of the AI investment cycle that started in 2023. And as you know, a number of concerns that have emerged in recent months regarding the sustainability of AI scaling or... the ability to increase the performance of generative AI models by by just throwing more compute at them," Chkaiban explains to Yahoo Finance's Brad Smith and Brian Sozzi. "And on that front, well, I would say that the recent developments have clearly shown that, on the contrary, progress is very far from over and is, if anything, accelerating." Chkaiban also lays the significant players in growing AI infrastructure and platforms that aren't just Nvidia (NVDA). To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Morning Brief here. This post was written by Luke Carberry Mogan.

headline: Santa Claus rally, Nordstrom goes private, Nvidia: 3 Things
summary: US stock futures are mixed (ES=F, NQ=F, YM=F) Monday morning as investors remain hopeful of a Santa Claus rally to refresh the market (^DJI, ^IXIC, ^GSPC) ahead of the new year. The Nordstrom family and Mexican retailer El Puerto de Liverpool (ELPQF, PLV1.F) are acquiring Nordstrom, Inc. (JWN) in a $6.25 billion deal set to take the company private. While Nvidia (NVDA) shares have slipped lower in recent weeks, some on Wall Street are even anticipating slowing growth to come for the chip giant in 2025. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Morning Brief here. This post was written by Luke Carberry Mogan.

headline: Here's Why Costco Says It Has No Plans to Split Its Stock at $1,000 Per Share
summary: 2024 has been a momentous time for stock splits, with over a dozen leading companies choosing to split their stocks this year.  Warren Buffett's conglomerate Berkshire Hathaway (NYSE: BRK.A) (NYSE: BRK.B) has famously never split its A shares, which go for a whopping $670,000 apiece!  Berkshire also has lower-priced B shares, which began trading in 1996 -- but even those shares have appreciated to split-worthy levels of $453 per share, which is still lofty for many retail investors.

raw.headline: Here's Why Costco Says It Has No Plans to Split Its Stock at $1,000 Per Share

Berkshire also has lower-priced B shares, which began trading in 1996 -- but even those shares have appreciated to split-worthy levels of $453 per share, which is still lofty for many retail investors.

headline: Apple approaches $4 trillion valuation as investors bet on AI momentum
summary: Apple is closing in on a historic $4 trillion stock market valuation, powered by investors cheering progress in the company's long-awaited AI enhancements to rejuvenate sluggish iPhone sales.  The company has pulled ahead of Nvidia and Microsoft in the race to the monumental milestone, thanks to an about 16% jump in shares since early November that has added about $500 billion to its market capitalization.  The latest rally in Apple shares reflects "investor enthusiasm for artificial intelligence and an expectation that it will result in a supercycle of iPhone upgrades," said Tom Forte, an analyst at Maxim Group, who has a "hold" rating.

The latest rally in Apple shares reflects "investor enthusiasm for artificial intelligence and an expectation that it will result in a supercycle of iPhone upgrades," said Tom Forte, an analyst at Maxim Group, who has a "hold" rating.

headline: 1 Unstoppable Vanguard ETF to Buy With $630 During the S&P 500 Sell-Off
summary: The S&P 500 (SNPINDEX: ^GSPC) is up 24% this year, which is more than double its average annual return going back to when it was established in 1957.  Investors are digesting a new forecast from the Federal Reserve for 2025, which points to fewer interest rate cuts than expected.  Since the technology sector led the S&P higher this year thanks to themes like artificial intelligence (AI), that might be a great place for investors to find value.

headline: Warren Buffett Recommends This Index Fund. It Could Turn $500 Per Month Into $968,900
summary: Under his leadership, Berkshire Hathaway's share price has grown at 20% annually since 1965.  Consequently, many investors avidly track the stocks Buffett is buying and selling with SEC Forms 13F.  "In my view, for most people, the best thing to do is to own the S&P 500 index fund," Buffett said at Berkshire's annual meeting 2021.
